mdRecord.dcterms:description: 1200 acres and additional 200-acre homesite purchased by Peter Jefferson, 1736. In October 1739, he married Jane Randolph; original house completed about 1741. Thomas Jefferson, their third child and first son, was born at Shadwell in 1743. Thomas Jefferson inherited the Shadwell plantation in 1764. In February 1770, the one-and-a-half story frame house burned. The surrounding acreage continued to serve as farmland, one of Jefferson’s four quarter farms in Albemarle County. In 1813, Jefferson deeded the property to his grandson, Thomas Jefferson Randolph. [work]

In 1991, an archaeological excavation on the property uncovered two cellar foundations, one of which is believed to be the site of the original main house built by Peter Jefferson. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shadwell,_Virginia [work]
